Kentucky-Texas basketball live blog

The Wildcats and Longhorns tip off at 7 p.m. inside Rupp Arena.

Kentucky-Texas basketball live blog

Jonathan Lintner, jlintner@courier-journal.com 8:19 p.m. EST December 5, 2014

Texas' Jonathan Holmes, right, shoots near Kentucky's Trey Lyles during the first half of an NCAA college basketball game, Friday, Dec. 5, 2014, in Lexington, Ky. (AP Photo/James Crisp)(Photo: James Crisp, AP)

6 CONNECT 8 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Refresh regularly (or click here) for updates during the University of Kentucky's 7 p.m. Friday basketball game against Texas at Rupp Arena.

20:00, 2H: The platoons have been broken up to start the second half. On the floor to the Cats are Tyler Ulis, Devin Booker, Willie Cauley-Stein, Trey Lyles and Dakari Johnson. So essentially, the White Platoon with Cauley-Stein rather than Marcus Lee.

Halftime: Texas had a chance at the final shot but turned it over. UK, with seven seconds left, did the same. It's 26-26 at the break.

Said coach John Calipari, with his team facing a 27-11 rebounding deficit: "This game is a dog fight. They've got the dogs. We don't right now. so we'll have to see if we have some dogs in that locker room who will go out and play without fouling."

Follow this link for a full box score: http://bit.ly/12t4rZh

HALFTIME: No. 1 Kentucky 26, No. 6 Texas 26. Cats 8-25 FG, Horns 7-25 FG. UK 6 TO, UT 13 TO. 25 total fouls, 34 free throws. Vomit.

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) December 6, 2014

2:39, 1H: Rick Barnes has four players with two fouls -- all of them on the bench -- and yet is tied 22-22 with UK. One thought -- if UK's platoons are to wear down an opponent, does it happen to a lesser degree tonight considering how little some of the Longhorns' stars have played?

Not that UK's foul situation is much better. Both Trey Lyles and Dakari Johnson have three.

Kentucky's blue platoon averages 79.8 points per 40 minutes. The white platoon averages exactly 79 points. pic.twitter.com/2yxK0Gr0zr

— ESPN College BBall (@ESPNCBB) December 6, 2014

3:33, 1H: On a Willie Cauley-Stein jumper, assisted by Tyler Ulis, UK's matched its largest lead -- 2 points -- into the under-four timeout. The Cats have surged ahead 22-20 on an 8-0 run, hitting their last three buckets following a 3 of 18 start from the field.

4:15, 1H: Momentum shifted quickly in UK's favor. Karl-Anthony Towns hit a pair of free throws and followed with a jumper. At the other end, he grabbed a rebound, leading to a Tyler Ulis shot that has Rupp Arena in a frenzy and the score tied 20-20. All in all, it was a 6-0 run over 21 seconds.

4:35, 1H: Officials had to to make a controversial call. Karl-Anthony Towns absorbed a shot from Texas' Jonathan Holmes and hit the ground hard. Referees went to the monitor and discerned it was a flagrant 1 foul, meaning Holmes made a play at the ball. It was his second whistle of the night. Towns is OK.

Karl-Anthony Towns fouled hard in 1st. #BBN@johnclayivpic.twitter.com/7cU3faITaD

— JonathanPalmer (@JonathanPalmer) December 6, 2014

5:17, 1H: Down 18-14, UK is living from the line. The Cats have made just 3 of their 17 shots but thanks to Texas' foul trouble are getting to the line plenty. From there, UK's hit 8 of 13 attempts.

6:56, 1H: Three Texas players and two UK players have a pair of fouls. Trey Lyles just added a third. Platoons are mixed now with three guards on the floor -- Tyler Ulis, Devin Booker and Aaron Harrison -- with no small forward, Lyles' spot.

6:57, 1H: A Connor Lammert 3-pointer has Texas ahead 18-13 -- the Longhorns' largest lead -- at the under-eight timeout. UK's rebounding deficit stands at 16-6 as bodies fly after every shot. There's perhaps no other team in the country with length close to matching the Cats.

"Texas vs Kentucky" trending nationally right now, along with French Toast Crunch. Interesting. pic.twitter.com/bPQVKSf2Mx

— Lindsay Travis (@LindsayTravis15) December 6, 2014

8:25, 1H: Marcus Lee and Dakari Johnson mixed with the Blue Platoon's Harrison twins and Alex Poythress. Defense is still dominating on both ends with Texas ahead 15-13.

10:11, 1H: A great stat from ESPN -- while Texas has missed seven shots and rebounded on six of them, the Longhorns have converted that into just 3 points. Credit UK's length at the rim. Texas leads 13-11.

10:56, 1H: Add another to the two-foul club. Karl-Anthony Towns picked up his second into the under-12 timeout. The Cats have forced 8 Texas turnovers already but trail 10-9 having missed 7 of their first 9 shots. Oh, and how about a 13-2 Longhorns advantage on the boards?

Texas' size is a factor. Kentucky getting killed 13-2 on the glass, trails Horns 10-9 with 10:57 left in the half. Towns' second foul.

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) December 6, 2014

12:16, 1H: Make it two fouls now for Prince Ibeh and Cameron Ridley, both on Texas' bench. The Longhorns are deep, but their best options are sitting, now down 9-8.

13:13, 1H: There's been no shortage of offensive fouls in this one, enough to force Texas to its fourth man off the bench already. Trey Lyles just charged into his second whistle but will remain on the court with his platoon.

13:47, 1H: Texas, ahead 8-5, has stormed ahead thanks to a monstrous dunk by Prince Ibeh (pronounced Ibeh) and offensive rebounding edge. The Longhorns already have four of them.

15:46, 1H: A Texas turnover sends this one to the under-16 media timeout, the Longhorns and Cats tied 3-3. UK's length is bothering Texas early. Rick Barnes' team is off to a 1 of 5 shooting start, its lone bucket a Jonathan Holmes 3-pointer.

After the break, in will come the second platoon. Cue a shirt change for the student section...

You know it's a big game when Worldwide Wes is in the building. pic.twitter.com/TazIq4cdLd

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) December 5, 2014

17:24, 1H: Make it two fouls for Cameron Ridley, both on the offensive end. It's a key moment early with UK still ahead 2-0. In comes Myles Turner, the star freshman.

19:15, 1H: With a mid-range jumper on UK's second trip up the floor, Aaron Harrison put the Cats on the board. At the other end, Texas star Cameron Ridley committed his first foul, giving possession back to the Cats.

20:00, 1H: No surprises in either starting lineup. One thing to watch -- apparently, students in the "eRUPPtion Zone" will change their shirts between blue and white when platoons change this evening.

The Big 12 leads the SEC Challenge 4-1 so far. And Texas, like Kansas, has a potential lottery pick coming off the bench in Myles Turner.

Be sure to pay attn to the eRUPPtion Zone tonight. Fans will be changing shirts with each platoon. Awesome idea. pic.twitter.com/UsVtDEGQGK

— CoachCal.com (@CoachCalDotCom) December 5, 2014

PREGAME: Another major test for UK's has arrived, with No. 6 Texas gunning for its first-ever victory over an Associated Press No. 1-ranked team.

Both the Cats and Longhorns feature defense. UK has held three opponents to 40 points or less and blocks shots on 26.7 percent of foes' possessions. Texas has held each of its opponents to fewer than 60 points and 37 percent shooting.

The Lonhorns last played a No. 1 team in Feburary 2010, when Kansas topped the AP poll. The Longhorns did beat UCLA, then-ranked No. 1 in the USA Today rankings, in 2007. UK has won 25 of its last 27 against ranked foes.

For more pregame reading, check out a preview by UK beat writer Kyle Tucker (http://cjky.it/1vvZZVv) as well as game notes from both the Cats (http://bit.ly/1A27a75) and Longhorns (http://bit.ly/12sN8r4).

Less than two hours to tipoff for tonight's game vs. No. 6/7 Texas. pic.twitter.com/USNzcCY6Gk

— CoachCal.com (@CoachCalDotCom) December 5, 2014

Probable UK Platoon 1

G Andrew Harrison

G Aaron Harrison

F Alex Poythress

F Willie Cauley-Stein

F Karl-Anthony Towns

Probable UK Platoon 2

G Tyler Ulis

G Devin Booker

F Trey Lyles

F Marcus Lee

C Dakari Johnson

Projected Texas Starters

G Javan Felix

G Demarcus Holland

F Jonathan Holmes

F Connor Lammert

C Cameron Ridley
